title: Director, Data, Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence (AI)
description:
ITHAKA’s mission is to expand access to knowledge and education around the world. Our services — Artstor, JSTOR, Portico, and Ithaka S+R — enable people everywhere to learn, to grow, and to overcome historical barriers to education. In carrying out our mission, as employees we feel a deep responsibility to each other and our well-being, and are committed to building and sustaining a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace.

Responsibilities

The Director, Data, Analytics, and Artificial Intelligence (AI) will be a key executive leadership role responsible for setting the strategy and direction of our data engineering, analytics, and AI initiatives. You will oversee the development and implementation of data-driven solutions that help us reach our business goals, ensuring that our data practices are innovative, efficient, and aligned with industry best practices.

As Director of Data, Analytics and AI, you will create a vision and drive the execution of the organization’s use of our data on JSTOR, ITHAKA’s research platform product, and Portico, ITHAKA’s digital preservation service. In this role you will:

Lead the creation and execution of a comprehensive data vision and strategy, encompassing data infrastructure, machine learning/AI, predictive and prescriptive analytics, and governance to support ITHAKA's mission and goals.Provide visionary leadership to deliver actionable business insights to the ITHAKA leadership and other cross-functional leaders, influencing business strategy through data-driven decision-making.Manage a high-performing team of data engineers, data scientists, AI engineers and data analysts. Foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning.Oversee the selection, implementation, and optimization of data technologies as well as DataOps and AIOps best-practices. Ensure robust data governance, quality, and security practices.Work with the team and key users and product development teams to define key business questions; help business users in using analytic platforms.Guide the technical vision and strategy for developing an accurate, scalable, usable, and reliable data platform and infrastructure taking into account data governance and security.Drive the development and deployment of cutting-edge data analytics and AI solutions that enhance decision-making, operational efficiency, and customer experience.Work with other executives and department leaders to integrate data-driven insights into various aspects of the business. Act as a key advisor on matters related to data and analytics. Build effective partnerships with ITHAKA’s stakeholders by providing data driven recognition of targeted content and tools that deliver the highest value to their institution, students and researchers.Stay abreast of emerging trends, technologies, and best practices in data engineering, analytics, and AI. Recommend investments in technologies and initiatives that keep the company at the competitive edge.Establish Objectives and Key Results (OKRs) with the Data team that are aligned with organizational goals. Equip and inspire the team to meet and exceed OKR targets and maintain a forward-looking mindset focused on operational excellence.Create and maintain a culture of operational excellence and customer service in the data organization, ensuring healthy partnerships with various departments and products. Monitor satisfaction with data activities and resources, identify appropriate improvements and take action to implement them and monitor results.Foster an inclusive work environment where team members have a sense of pride, dedication, and belonging, and a culture that embraces and reinforces ITHAKA’s core values. Promote open communication, transparency, an inclusive work environment, continuous innovation, and recognition for excellent teamwork and great performance. Occasional travel, comprising less than 10% of the time, may be necessary, with a primary focus on visits to our Michigan and New York offices.

This is an unparalleled opportunity to bring visionary advances in the strategic use of data to organizations and to researchers, teachers, and students. The ideal candidate is an experienced, collegial leader who understands data science and is passionate about having a positive impact on the learning of others and our organizational mission.

Experience And Skills

Bachelors in Computer Science or similar technical degree or equivalent work experience.Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with a track record of building and developing high-performing data, analytics, and AI teams, and influencing and collaborating with cross-functional leaders.Exceptional business acumen and demonstrated ability to translate data insights into actionable business recommendations and strategic initiatives, using visualization and storytelling to enroll others to follow through on these recommendations.Track record of defining the high-level strategy and detailed execution road-map for data, analytics and AI.Extensive experience managing data, analytics and AI teams and projects in an agile, technology-driven environment.Proven track record of developing and executing data engineering, analytics and AI strategies that have significantly impacted business outcomes.Proven experience architecting complex data engineering, analytics and AI solutions.Experience with AWS cloud platform.Excellent technical background with knowledge of the latest in data processing technologies, analytics tools, and AI/machine learning models.Building real-time data ingestion streams using tools like Spark Streaming, Data lake, Databricks, etc.Agile background.Excellent communication skills, with experience communicating findings to both technical and non-technical audiences10 years experience working in the Information Technology industry.

Work Authorization and Sponsorship 

ITHAKA is not currently considering candidates who require any type of immigration sponsorship (additional work authorization or permanent work authorization) now or in the future to work in the United States.

Compensation And Benefits

At ITHAKA we believe in openness and equity. Part of living those values is our commitment to clarity about salary ranges, so candidates know what to expect. The starting salary for this position ranges from $159,703 to $199,630 per year. Starting pay may vary with job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. At present, our total compensation package for benefits-eligible employees includes medical, dental, and vision plans, an employer-paid 10% retirement contribution, paid parental and caregiver leave, 22 days of paid time off, 11 paid holidays, up to 12 sick days, wellness benefits, and more. Please note that ITHAKA, at its discretion, may make changes to its benefits programs from time to time.

Work for ITHAKA 

We are committed to our organizational values of belonging, evidence, speed, teamwork, and trust. We take inclusion seriously. Belonging is one of our core values, and it shows in our vibrant culture. People from a wide range of backgrounds work at ITHAKA, and we believe that unique perspectives help us realize new insights and build better solutions.

We want to work with people who are passionate about ideas like these and who wish to contribute their perspectives and talents to ITHAKA’s mission. We enthusiastically welcome applications from people of all underrepresented backgrounds and credentials. We want to hear your story and include your perspective in the transformative work we aim to do.

Learn more about Working at ITHAKA.

Apply Now:

Although ITHAKA has physical offices in New York and Ann Arbor, Michigan, our employees are distributed across the continental United States. At this time, we’re not considering candidates who are unable to work and reside in the continental U.S.

Candidates may apply by submitting an application online through our career site, if you have any questions about your application, please contact us at careers@ithaka.org. ITHAKA is committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if there’s anything we can do to accommodate any portion of the application or hiring process, please contact us at accommodations@ithaka.org.

All qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, religion, domestic violence victim status, veteran status, disability, history of disability or perceived disability, or other status protected by law.
